com.totsp.gwittir.client.flow
Class FlowController

java.lang.Object
  com.totsp.gwittir.client.flow.FlowController

public class FlowController
extends java.lang.Object

The FlowController class is used to register FlowContexts to Widget maps for page to page or wizard style application flows. See the package doc for details.

Author:
Robert "kebernet" Cooper

call

public static boolean call(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget sender,
                           java.lang.String name,
                           java.lang.Object model)
Calls a new flow context name, from the sender context with the given object model.

Parameters:
sender - The lowest level widget to begin looking for the name
name - The activity name to look for
model - The model object to pass to the registered BoundWidget
Returns:
boolean indicating whether the call resulted in a state change.

findContextWidget

public static com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget findContextWidget(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget widget,
                                                                     java.lang.String name)
Finds the first managed widget/panel from a source widget that has a name mapped in its flow context

Parameters:
widget - The low-level widget to search from
name - The name to search a flow context for
Returns:
the Managed widget that matches first.

findContext

public static FlowContext findContext(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget widget,
                                      java.lang.String name)
Find the FlowContext with a name mapping from the low level widget

Parameters:
widget - Widget to begin searching from
name - activity name to find
Returns:
a FlowContext or null.
